body:
I understand the desire to add new maps, but why get rid of these older maps?

These maps are great because success depends on which kit you start with and teamwork, at wall drop normally the best you can have is full iron armor, sometimes enchanted, sometimes not.

With the new maps at wall drop if you don't have full or at least partial diamond you are at a severe disadvantage, so the game becomes "who can get to the chest and get the overpowered loot first" and "who can get to the diamonds first"?  Seriously, games on the new maps are all about developing routines to get the loot and diamonds.

I'm not saying to go back to where the only maps are Walls and Jungle (and Village), but please keep them in the rotation.

And a suggestion for new maps - no diamonds except in the middle (like Jungle)!  Makes things much more fair at wall drop and lets you spend time on building things before wall drop rather than just going on a diamond hunt.

replies.body: AP! Great topic, but... The Jungle and Walls are the only maps that people don't play much. If people played them more I would be all for keeping them, but the jungle is on every server not being played just about, and when that map rotates around, players go to hub and leave it for dead and walls is 2nd on that list. I am with you, I like the older maps, but no one plays them, so I voted for them being taken away. I would rather play on a map with people than be on a map where after the walls drop 3-4 people are left or it takes 20 min to get a game going.  I was thinking of building a map that does not have diamonds, and seeing if the map devs like it, but has a little better game play and that is kit focused - to replace the walls/jungle style. I agree with some other posters, I am not a fan of the Tetris series, but that series is built well and fit resource wise into rotation ( to me the game play is so/so) and the tetris maps are never stuck in the rotation :). I hope that we end up with a great walls rotation where we like most of the maps, and we don't get into a situation where we have so many servers stuck on the same map. To me it is all about the fun, and the fun happens when players stay and play regardless of anything else. I think the walls game mode should have 200-300 people playing it at all time, and that is the only reason I started building maps.
